messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Protests
messages.msgSnippet: ... *That* is an understatement.  But, wasn t it GREAT!!  What a turnout, considering how frigid it was.  It seems that we were toward the beginning of the
messages.messageBody:
At 16:37 1/18/03 -0500, Shyrley wrote:
>Just got back.
>It was great, amazing, fantastic but boyohboy was it coooooooold!

*That* is an understatement. But, wasn't it GREAT!! What a turnout,
considering how frigid it was. It seems that we were toward the beginning
of the march as it left the Mall. Do you know where you were, Shyrley? I
was marching under a large pink homemade banner that said something like
"Warwick Peace Action Group" and "No Blood For Oil" and "Not in Our
Name." It could've been about 10 or 15 degrees warmer and then that would
have been great. The cops were a little scary at one point though,
right? Did you see when the parade went under the highway how the police
were lined up maybe every six feet or so on either side holding their
night-sticks?

I can't wait to see your pictures. I snapped a few too, but I have no idea
how they'll come out. I just held the camera up as high over my head as I
could and snapped away.

We didn't get home until about 1 in the morning, and it was 2 below zero
when we got back to my car. Brrrrrrr.

Glad to be home!

Marji

>I'm going to put my piccies up on my web site so I'll post the addy to
>that when its done. You can see Heather with her sign, and some fab
>banners we saw.
>
>Shyrley
>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Protests

messages.messageBody:
Beckyleach@... wrote:

> In a message dated 1/17/2003 8:09:56 PM Central Standard Time,
> Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
> > Heather and I are going too. See you in DC.
> > She'll be the 10 yo wearinga camo combat jacket that is adult size and I'll
> > have a black woolly hat on with a red bobble on top
>
> Thanks for going and representing so many of us....Many long sighs, here,
> that circumstances did not allow US to go, too!
>
> (and thanks for the warm welcome to the list, many of you! You made me blush.
> <g>)
>
> Becky in Iowa
>

Just got back.
It was great, amazing, fantastic but boyohboy was it coooooooold!
I'm going to put my piccies up on my web site so I'll post the addy to that when its done. You can see Heather with her sign, and some fab banners we saw.

Shyrley

messages.subject: Protests
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/17/2003 8:09:56 PM Central Standard Time, ... Thanks for going and representing so many of us....Many long sighs, here, that circumstances
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/17/2003 8:09:56 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Heather and I are going too. See you in DC.
> She'll be the 10 yo wearinga camo combat jacket that is adult size and I'll
> have a black woolly hat on with a red bobble on top

Thanks for going and representing so many of us....Many long sighs, here,
that circumstances did not allow US to go, too!

(and thanks for the warm welcome to the list, many of you! You made me blush.
<g>)

Becky in Iowa

"To announce that there must be no criticism of the president, or that we are
to stand by the president right or wrong, is not only unpatriotic and
servile, but is morally treasonable to the American public."
--Theodore Roosevelt
